titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Delany Sanders, Judgment
CWG4875

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Ky Plaintiff
Against } On an Indict
Delaney Sanders Defendant

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendant also appeared by his Attorney, and plead not guilty to the Charges in the Indictment, and thereupon came a jury to wit. Master C Davidson, Jefferson Richey, Phillip T Daniel, John B Messmore Anthony Crockett, James M Oldham, R G Roberts, William Clark Sr Edward Nichols Lucien Gibbs, John P Starms, James M Campbell were selected and sworn well and truly to try the issue, and having heard the evidence &c they retired to consider of verdict &c and after a short time returned into Court the following verdict to wit "We of the Jury fine the Defendant sixty two dollars"

Whereupon it is edjudged by the Court that the Defendant Delaney Sanders make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of the sum of Sixty two dollars, and the costs of this prosecution, and may be taken &c
A copy Attest Eldred E Pate Clk H. C. C.

Commonwealth
vs } Judgement copy
Delaney Sanders
